def right_angle_triangle(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return True if the three
    sides form a right-angled triangle, False otherwise.
    A right-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is right angle or 
    90 degree.
    Example:
    right_angle_triangle(3, 4, 5) == True
    right_angle_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False
    '''
    if a == b:
        return True
    if a == c:
        return False
    if b == c:
        return True
    if a == b:
        return False
    if b == a:
        return True
    return False

def right_angle_triangle(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return True if the three
    sides form a right-angled triangle, False otherwise.
    A right-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is right angle or 
    90 degree.
    Example:
    right_angle_triangle(3, 4, 5) == True
    right_angle_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False
    '''
    if a == b:
        return True
    if a == c:
        return False
    if b == c:
        return True
    if a == b or b == c:
        return True
    return False

def right_angle_triangle(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return True if the three
    sides form a right-angled triangle, False otherwise.

    90 degree.

    right_angle_triangle(3, 4, 5) == True
    right_angle_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False
    '''
    if a == b == c:
        return True
    if a < b:
        return False
    if a > c:
        return False
    if b < c:
        return False
    if b > a:
        return False
    return True

        return False
    if b == a:
        return True
    return False

    '''

    sides form a right-angled triangle, False otherwise.

    90 degree.

    '''
    if a == b:
        return True
    if a == c:
        return False
    if b == c:
        return True
    if a == b:
        return False
    if b == a:
        return False
    return False
